result.execSummary:
The defendant Nikolaus W. Schmidt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any other probation defendant is now serving

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or a combination thereof, or for any week defendant does not hold that status, he must complete 10 hours community service per week.
No contact with victim Fleet Farm in Wausau.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.
Probation may be transferred to Lincoln Co.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nikolaus W. Schmidt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing, and Order Extending Probation For Unpaid Court Obligations.
Probation extended for 9 months, from 5/21/16 to 2/21/17; or until all court obligations are completed, whichever comes first.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 9:08am
State appears by ADA C.Minder.  Def appears in person and with Atty Amanda Ley.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

State moves to:
Ct.1 (Retail Theft/Repeater)>>AMEND to DELETE Repeater allegation
Ct. 2 (Retail Theft/Repeater)>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
Ct. 1 (Retail Theft)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held; 9 months Probation, concurrent to any other probation defendant now serving.
CONDITIONS of PROBATION: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; N/C w/victim Fleet Farm in Wausau; Restitution to victim of $4.79 within first month of probation; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, or for any week defendant does not hold that staus, he must complete 10 hours of C.S./week; CC; DNA sample and surcharge.

>> COURT advises defendant of possible right to expungement of DNA SAMPLE only under certain statutory authority.
>>Parties to submit stipulation as to sentence credit in the event of any revocation.
>>Probation to be transferred to LINCOLN County.

Adj: 9:16am

No contact with victim(s):  Fleet Farm in Wausau.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
Defendant bonded out of jail to appear at a later date.
